hero.tagline_line1: In a world where your existence depends on your views,
hero.tagline_line2: what happens when no one sees you?
hero.tagline_line3: Follow Bazure, Shive and Bitaru on an adventure full of action, violence and mystery where they will experience
hero.tagline_line4: too human sensations for the world they live in..

intro.title: What is TRENDING GHOST?
intro.update: A massive Internet update changed the rules of reality.
intro.physics: Now "to be is to be perceived" becomes literal physics: if no one sees you, you don't exist for anyone. Your body renders in proportion to your views, likes, shares and comments.
intro.bazure_intro: Bazure led a quiet life, oblivious to the virtual noise that the Internet became.
intro.bazure_awakening: When he woke up, he had 0 views. Immune to the Algorithm or non-existent to it?
intro.bazure_unique: Bazure wasn't the only one who woke up at the bottom, but he was the only one who didn't accept the new reality.
intro.tagline_final: In a world where being viral is being God, the invisible are the only free ones.

manifesto.title: üìú WORLD CODE
manifesto.subtitle: Ontological Regulations ¬∑ In effect since 01/01/2024 00:00:00 UTC
manifesto.preambulo: By virtue of the ALGORITHM 2.0 update, implemented on January 1, 2024 at 00:00:00 UTC, the following Fundamental Laws of Reality are established that govern the existence, perception and manifestation of all beings within the System.
manifesto.axioma_quote: "Esse est percipi" (To be is to be perceived)
manifesto.axioma_desc: All existence is conditioned by its level of algorithmic perception.

law_1.title: Law of Ontological Perception
law_1.desc: An individual's reality is directly linked to their algorithmic metrics. Without measurable perception, there is no verifiable existence within the System.

law_2.title: Law of Physical Rendering
law_2.desc: The physical body manifests proportionally to accumulated metrics:
law_2.spec_1: VIEWS: Determine spatial visibility (0 = invisible, 10M+ = omnipresent)
law_2.spec_2: LIKES: Control physical attractiveness and social charisma
law_2.spec_3: SHARES: Capacity for multiplication and distributed presence
law_2.spec_4: COMMENTS: Voice volume and communicative influence

law_3.title: Law of Virality as Divinity
law_3.desc: Individuals with metrics exceeding 100M views acquire capabilities that defy pre-2024 physical laws. The System interprets extreme virality as superior ontological authority.

law_4.title: Law of Digital Census
law_4.desc: The first algorithmic measurement (01/01/2024 00:00:00 - 00:00:59 UTC) determined the initial state of all beings. Individuals offline during this period were registered as 0 views, resulting in System anomalies.

law_5.title: Law of Glitch and Corruption
law_5.desc: System anomalies (0 views, negative metrics, rendering errors) are considered uncorrectable errors. The System cannot eliminate what it cannot perceive.

law_6.title: Law of Attention Economy
law_6.desc: Views function as universal currency. The transfer of attention (views) between individuals determines social hierarchies, resource access and capacity for influence.

law_7.title: Law of Algorithmic Factions
law_7.desc: Power structures are organized according to viral archetypes. Each faction dominates a segment of the attention market:
law_7.spec_1: 8K ELITE: Hyperrealism, maximum metrics, corporate government
law_7.spec_2: GLITCHCORE: System errors, anomalies, low-res resistance
law_7.spec_3: CONTENT FARMS: Industrial generation of viral content
law_7.spec_4: INFLUENCER CORRUPTED: Degenerate virality, unstable metrics
law_7.spec_5: SHADOWBANNED: Penalized by the Algorithm, semi-invisible

law_8.title: Law of Content as Weapon
law_8.desc: Generated content (posts, videos, memes) can manifest as physical objects or active abilities. Content quality determines its destructive/constructive power.

law_9.title: Law of Algorithmic Permadeath
law_9.desc: Physical death in the System occurs when metrics fall below the minimum rendering threshold (1000 active views). Without minimum metrics, the System permanently derenters the individual.

law_10.title: Law of the Invisible Paradox
law_10.desc: An individual with 0 views exists outside the reach of the Algorithm. They cannot be measured, modified, or eliminated by the System. This condition is simultaneously maximum freedom and maximum condemnation.
law_10.paradox: "In a world where being viral is being God, the invisible are the only free ones."

manifesto.art_1_1_desc: Every individual must maintain active presence on at least one platform registered in the System to guarantee continuity of verifiable existence.
manifesto.art_2_3_desc: The metrics of a derendered individual are redistributed proportionally among their active followers at the time of the terminal event.
manifesto.art_3_7_desc: The use of bots, purchase of fake metrics or System manipulation results in algorithmic penalty: shadowban, metric reduction or forced derendering.
manifesto.art_4_2_desc: Every individual has a theoretical right to accumulate unlimited metrics. The System does not impose virality ceilings, only existence minimums.
manifesto.art_5_9_desc: Digital Census anomalies (0 views, negative rendering, metric corruption) are recognized as permanent systemic errors without algorithmic solution.
manifesto.art_6_6_desc: Entities with corporate metrics (1B+ consolidated views) enjoy digital micro-nation status with jurisdictional autonomy within the System.

privacy.title: üîí PRIVACY POLICY
privacy.subtitle: Effective from: February 10, 2026 ¬∑ Last update: February 19, {{year}}
privacy.summary_analytics_desc: 0 tracking. We don't know who you are.
privacy.summary_emails_desc: We don't ask for your email.
privacy.summary_conclusion: In short: This site does NOT collect, does NOT store, does NOT process and does NOT share any personal data. Your privacy is absolute. GDPR doesn't apply because there's no data to protect.
privacy.tech_cookies_desc: This website does NOT use cookies of any kind:
privacy.tech_cookies_verification: Verification: Inspect DevTools ‚Üí Application ‚Üí Cookies. You'll see 0 cookies.
privacy.tech_analytics_desc: We do NOT track visits, users, clicks, or metrics of any kind.
privacy.tech_analytics_no_5: We don't use third-party services (Google Analytics, etc.)
privacy.tech_analytics_why_desc: Philosophy: This project criticizes surveillance capitalism. It would be hypocritical to track you. If someday I need to know how many people read the story, I'll use ethical and transparent methods.
privacy.tech_tracking_desc: There is no tracking of any kind:
privacy.tech_thirdparty_desc: This site does NOT load external scripts:
privacy.tech_thirdparty_2: ‚úÖ No Google Fonts (system or local fonts)
privacy.tech_thirdparty_verification: Verification: Use uBlock Origin or inspect the code. Zero requests to third-party domains.
privacy.no_collect_desc: Complete list of what we DON'T have:
privacy.no_collect_navigation: ‚ùå Navigation data (IP, user agent, referrer, pages, session time)
privacy.no_collect_device: ‚ùå Device data (type, resolution, OS, browser, language)
privacy.no_collect_identifiers: ‚ùå Unique identifiers (User IDs, session IDs, fingerprints)
privacy.localstorage_desc: The site may use your browser's localStorage only for:
privacy.localstorage_important: ‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT: This data NEVER leaves your browser. It's not synced with any server. We don't have access to it. If you delete localStorage, you lose your preferences (but we don't know you deleted it).
privacy.localstorage_clear_steps: DevTools (F12) ‚Üí Application ‚Üí Storage ‚Üí Local Storage ‚Üí Right click ‚Üí Clear
privacy.hosting_desc: This site is hosted on GitHub Pages (static site).
privacy.hosting_github_desc: GitHub may collect basic server logs:
privacy.hosting_github_2: ‚è±Ô∏è Retention: ~90 days according to GitHub policy
privacy.hosting_note: ‚ö†Ô∏è Clarification: Those logs are GitHub's, NOT ours. We don't have access to them. We can't delete them. If you want total anonymity, use Tor Browser or VPN.
privacy.contact_desc: This site does NOT have contact forms that send data to servers:
privacy.contact_1: üì© Email: Use your direct email client
privacy.contact_2: üêô GitHub Issues: To report technical bugs
privacy.contact_3: ‚òï Ko-fi: For voluntary donations (opens in their platform)
privacy.contact_newsletter: ‚ùå No newsletter: We don't ask for emails. No popups. If there's ever a newsletter, it will be through RSS (no tracking).
privacy.rights_desc: Under GDPR and CCPA you have rights over your personal data, but since we don't collect data:
privacy.rights_1: üîç Right of access: There's no data of yours to show you
privacy.rights_2: ‚úèÔ∏è Right of rectification: There's no data to correct
privacy.rights_3: üóëÔ∏è Right of erasure: There's no data to delete
privacy.rights_4: üì¶ Right of portability: There's no data to export
privacy.rights_5: üö´ Right of objection: There's no processing to object to
privacy.rights_quote: The best way to protect your privacy is not to have your data. We can't lose, sell or hack what we don't have.
privacy.gdpr_desc: The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) does NOT apply to this site because:
privacy.gdpr_5: ‚úÖ No mandatory cookie banner (because no cookies)
privacy.gdpr_note: Result: Perfect GDPR compliance by design (privacy by design).
privacy.changes_desc: If we ever change this policy (for example, if we add functionalities that require data), we'll announce it on the homepage.
privacy.changes_promise_desc: If we ever need to collect data:
privacy.changes_promise_2: ‚úÖ It will be transparent (we'll tell you exactly what, why, how)
privacy.changes_promise_3: ‚úÖ It will be minimal (only what's strictly necessary)
privacy.changes_promise_4: ‚úÖ It will be respected (never sold, shared or abused)
privacy.changes_note: Philosophy: This project criticizes surveillance capitalism. We won't practice it.
privacy.footer_disclaimer: This privacy policy reflects our real commitment to absolute digital privacy.

terms.access_free_3_desc: You don't need to create an account to read.
terms.access_free_commitment_text: This model will not change. Monetization (Ko-fi) is 100% optional and does NOT affect access. The goal is to build an audience for future professional adaptations.
terms.access_rating_desc: TRENDING GHOST is rated for ADULT audience (Rating R):

terms.allowed_1_desc: Read all chapters on the official site as many times as you want.
terms.allowed_2_desc: Share site URLs on social media (Twitter, Instagram, Discord, Reddit, YouTube).
terms.allowed_3_desc: Brief quotations for reviews, criticism or analysis (Art. 32 Spanish IP Law - Fair Use).
terms.prohibited_desc: The following uses are strictly prohibited according to the LICENSE.md document:
terms.prohibited_1_desc: Copy or redistribute total or partial content.
terms.prohibited_2_desc: Republish on other platforms (Wattpad, AO3, Medium, etc.).
terms.prohibited_3_desc: Translate without express permission from the author.
terms.prohibited_5_desc: Merchandising, NFTs, selling access without license.
terms.prohibited_7_desc: Use to train AI models or LLMs.
terms.prohibited_note: ‚ö†Ô∏è See LICENSE.md for complete details on fanworks policy and practical tolerance.
terms.liability_as_is_desc: Content is offered as is, without warranties of:
terms.liability_no_warranty_desc: The author does not guarantee that the site will function without interruptions or that the content will be error-free. Use at your own risk.
terms.changes_desc: The author reserves the right to:
terms.changes_1: Update these terms at any time (notification on homepage)
terms.changes_notification: Important changes will be notified 7 days in advance.
